Winrar extracts them in 1 go, extract the file with .rar extension and it will automatically cycle through the .r00 files & output the contents

New to this...I see someone mentioned WinRar...willUtoreent do this as well...anything special that needs to be done before playing...just using cpu to play. Thanks in advance.

The subtitles are English srt softsubs (you can enable disable and format them). They are throughout the movie, not only for non English parts.

Video quality is great.

To unpack open down-ingb-1080p.rar with winrar and extract.
The subs are very much hardcoded.  They're not SRT files either.  Have you even looked at the files?

movieshopper70

"New to this...I see someone mentioned WinRar...willUtoreent do this as well...anything special that needs to be done before playing..."

utorrent just downloads the files.  in this case they are rar files.  To open .rar files, you use winrar, and select the one ending in .rar, not .r03 and so on.  Then, after unraring, you have a MKV file, for this, you will need VLC player, get it from http://videolan.org.  and have a fast computer with a true 1080p monitor.  
FYI everybody, if you have even a little sub, use the 5.1 sound encoding for a much better experience!!!!!!    
This movie is a real fine piece of work btw...
V:10
A:10

"It's like releasing DVDR's that don't run in DVD Players." -Murlok

Not to nitpick, but don't must dvd releases require transcoding to burn onto DVDs?  Pretty much everything is in either avi, mp4 or mpg, none of which can be burned to DVD player-compatible DVDs without transcoding.  It kind of kills the analogy a little bit..
